sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"陪同，伴随"之意
means: accompany ：既可指人也可指物。用于人时，侧重关系紧密或同时发生。
conduct ：无论用于人或物均指引导带领。
attend ：侧重主从关系，即下级对上级，学生对老师等，或表恭、服侍。
escort ：通常指用车或人在陆上伴随、护送，其目的是保护或出于礼节。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都含"引导"之意。
means: direct ： 指为某人指方向，但自己不一定亲自引路，也可表示指导一群人的事或活动。
conduct ： 正式用词，指引导某人去某处，强调亲自带领；也强调监督管理一群有共同目的或目标的人。
guide ： 普通用词，可与conduct换用，指引导者与被引导者双方彼此合作，共同努力的关系。
lead ： 指走在前面给某人引路或带路人共同去达到某一目标。用于抽象意义时，指在某项活动或运动中起主导和组织作用。
pilot ： 从原义"为飞机、轮船导航"借喻为指亲自带领某人去某处。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"做，执行，实施，完成"之意。
means: perform ： 指完成困难较大、较复杂的任务。较正式用词。
conduct和perform一样比较正式，二者意义相近，但conduct含指导、领导或监督等意味。
do ： 最普通常用词，指完成某项具体工作、任务，也指完成某种行为或动作。
execute ： 指需专门技术熟练技巧去完成某种复杂的任务或表演等，也指用行动把计划或打算付诸实施或执行某项命令。
fulfil ： 指履行和实现所许诺的、所期望或要求的事情，含最终完成的意味。

sentence.Network_en: The evaluation of conduct involves some amount of generalization.
sentence.Network_cn: 对操行的评价会含有一些泛泛之论。

sentence.Network_en: Rules governing student conduct relaxed somewhat in recent years.
sentence.Network_cn: 近年来约束学生行为的规定有所放宽。

sentence.Network_en: In most of the residence halls we visited, rules prohibit disorderly conduct.
sentence.Network_cn: 在我们走访的学生宿舍里，大多明令禁止胡作非为。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French, from Latin conduct- 'brought together', from the verb conducere. The term originally denoted some provision for safe passage, such as an escort or pass, surviving in safe conduct; later the verb sense 'lead, guide' arose, hence 'manage' and 'management' (late Middle English), later 'management of oneself, behaviour' (mid 16th cent.). The original form of the word was conduit, which was preserved only in the sense 'channel' (see conduit); in all other uses the spelling was influenced by Latin

entry.def: When you conduct an activity or task, you organize it and carry it out.

example.ex: I decided to conduct an experiment...
He said they were conducting a campaign against democrats across the country...
example.tran: 他说他们正在全国开展反对民主党人的运动。

entry.tran: (任务或活动的)组织方式，实施办法
entry.def: The conduct of a task or activity is the way in which it is organized and carried out.

example.ex: Also up for discussion will be the conduct of free and fair elections...
example.tran: 同样提出来进行讨论的还有如何进行自由公正的选举。

example.ex: The Conservative Party did not in the main disagree with Bevin's conduct of foreign policy.
example.tran: 保守党大体上不反对贝文的外交施政方式。

entry.def: If you conduct yourself in a particular way, you behave in that way.

example.ex: The way he conducts himself reflects on the party and will increase criticisms against him...
example.tran: 他个人的行事方式给该党招来非议，也会招致更多对他个人的批评。

example.ex: Most people believe they conduct their private and public lives in accordance with Christian morality.
example.tran: 大多数人认为他们是依照基督教的道德体系来处理自己的私生活和公共事务的。

entry.def: Someone's conduct is the way they behave in particular situations.

example.ex: For Europeans, the law is a statement of basic principles of civilised conduct...
example.tran: 对于欧洲人来说，法律是对基本文明行为准则的表述。

example.ex: He has trouble understanding that other people judge him by his conduct.
example.tran: 别人通过他的行为举止对他进行评判，这一点他很难理解。

entry.tran: 指挥(管弦乐队或合唱团)
entry.def: When someone conducts an orchestra or choir, they stand in front of it and direct its performance.

example.ex: Dennis had recently begun a successful career conducting opera in Europe...
example.tran: 丹尼斯最近开始在欧洲担任歌剧指挥，事业发展得很成功。

example.ex: Solti will continue to conduct here and abroad...
example.tran: 索尔蒂将继续在国内外担任指挥。

entry.def: If something conducts heat or electricity, it allows heat or electricity to pass through it or along it.

example.ex: Water conducts heat faster than air.
example.tran: 水的导热速度比空气快。

entry.def: If you conduct someone to a place, you go there with them.

example.ex: He asked if he might conduct us to the ball which was to bring the proceedings to an end.
example.tran: 他问是否可以带我们去舞会现场，整个仪式将在那儿结束。

means.word_mean: 1. manner of acting or conducting yourself
2. (behavioral attributes) the way a person behaves toward other people
1. direct the course of; manage or control;
2. lead, as in the performance of a composition;

sentences.sentence: "conduct an orchestra; Bairenboim conducted the Chicago symphony for years"
"They conducted themselves well during these difficult times"

means.word_mean: 4. transmit or serve as the medium for transmission;

sentences.sentence: "can you take me to the main entrance?"

means.word_mean: 6. lead musicians in the performance of;

sentences.sentence: "Bernstein conducted Mahler like no other conductor"

via路+duct引导,带来→引导路的路
con共同+duct引导,带来→引导大家一起指挥

stems_affixes.value_cn: 引出, 排出, 推断, 引出物

product[n.产品,产物;乘积]+ivity表名词→n.生产率
seduct=seduce[v.勾引,诱惑]+ion动作或状态→n.诱惑
vent风,通风+i+duct引导,带来→引导通风

stems_affixes.value_cn: 引导;管理;指挥[乐队];传导

in进入+duct引导,带来→引进→引导

Sentence.sentence: The team conducted a computer-based analysis to determine the impact a 3-g-per-day reduction in salt intake on rates of heart disease and death.
According to a survey on reading conducted in 2001 by the U.S. National Education Association (NEA), young Americans say reading is important, more important than computers and science.
In a similar survey conducted in Japan, the most popular free time activity was eating out.
His conduct does not square with his words

Director of the Advanced Tissue Biofabrication Center in the Department of Regenerative Medicine and Cell Biology at the medical university, Mironov now primarily conducts research on tissue engineering, or growing, of human organs.

The World Cancer Research Fund (WCRF) conducted a survey of iced coffees sold by some popular chains in Britain including Starbucks, Caffe Nero and Costa Coffee to gauge the calories as studies increasingly link obesity with cancer.

sentences.cn: 他们雇请代理人来管理他们的公司。

sentences.en: He is famous for his good conduct.
sentences.cn: 他因良好的行为而远近闻名。

sentences.cn: 她在一个拥有40种乐器的管弦乐队里当指挥。

jushi.english: The business is conducted from small offices in the City.
jushi.chinese: 这买卖是由伦敦商业区的小营业所管理的。
